Description: Intense apple-green glaze inside and out. Curved wall fragment from an open form, probably a bowl. No diagnostic features.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Apple-green glaze is diagnostic of the early Ptolemaic period (Nenna 2013, 127). From Naukratis. 1885: excavated by William Matthew Flinders Petrie for the Egypt Exploration Fund, assigned to the EEF by the Egyptian government; October 28, 1885: voted to the MFA at EEF general meeting; sent over February 1886. (Accession date: 1886). Found with faience objects given by the EEF: Eg.Inv.3577 to Eg.Inv.3595 and 02.770, 72.1418, and 88.1003, P.725 to P.824, P.4418 to P.8145.
Probably fragment in top left corner of image with five fragments
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.22)
